intro: Pisonia mitis, commonly known as the silky pisonia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, white, fluffy flowers that resemble clouds. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and often covered in fine, silky hairs. Pisonia mitis thrives in coastal areas and is often found in dry, sunny habitats.
